reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Training school for Afro-descendent leaders in economic, social and cultural rights

description.narrative: This award strives to help nations achieve sustainable improvements in the well-being and productivity of their populations through effective and accountable investments in education and other social services. This includes Ashanti Perú Red Peruana de Jóvenes Afrodescendientes (Ashanti Peru), in partnership with Asociación Negra de Defensa y Promoción de los Derechos Humanos (ASONEDH), will develop the capabilities of 60 young Afro-Peruvians to advocate for inclusive public policies. It will also carry out activities aimed at strengthening the cultural identity of an additional 750 youths from poor districts of Lima and forming networks aimed at sustaining the project's goals and objectives.. Ashanti Perú Red Peruana de Jóvenes Afrodescendientes (Ashanti Peru), in partnership with Asociación Negra de Defensa y Promoción de los Derechos Humanos (ASONEDH), will develop the capabilities of 60 young Afro-Peruvians to advocate for inclusive public. Ashanti Perú Red Peruana de Jóvenes Afrodescendientes (Ashanti Peru) in partnership with Asociación Negra de Defensa y Promoción de los Derechos Humanos (ASONEDH) will develop the capabilities of 60 young Afro-Peruvians to advocate for inclusive public po.

To help nations achieve sustainable improvements in the well-being and productivity of their populations through effective and accountable investments in education and other social services. Promote equitable, effective, accountable, and sustainable formal and non-formal education systems.

participating-org.narrative: Ashanti Perú Red Peruana de Jóvenes Afrodescendientes
The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

mailing-address.narrative: 1331 Pennsylvania Ave. NW, Suite 1200 NorthÂ Washington, DC 20004

description.narrative: U.S. assistance builds the capacity of Peruvian institutions to combat transnational organized crime more effectively, improve citizen security and social inclusion, sustainably manage Peru's diverse and fragile environment, and expand the benefits of Peru's economic progress to more of its citizens. Peru is one of the world's largest cocaine producers, a major money laundering center, a principal source of illegally logged timber and illegally mined gold, and the largest source of counterfeit U.S. currency worldwide. While economic growth has slowed for the past two years due to a slump in international commodity prices and the failure to implement second generation reforms, successive Peruvian governments have pursued judicious, market-based economic policies yielding over a decade of economic growth averaging five percent, which has halved poverty rates, reduced infant mortality, increased lifespans, and expanded access to education. Peru is one of the United States' most steadfast democratic partners in the region, and the continuation of bi-lateral assistance advances U.S. national security and economic interests.
Disbursement of funds to the Award Implementing Organization to carry out the activities set forth in Annex A of the grant agreement.
